definition: water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes
puffed/swollen/spongy/small lake (esp. in place names)/classifier for urine or feces

bubble/foam/blister (i.e. skin bubble)/to soak/to steep/to infuse/to dawdle/to shilly-shally/to hang about/to pick up (a girl)/to get off with (a sexual partner)/classifier for occurrences of an action/classifier for number of infusions

sentences.english: The white felt yurts of the Mongolian people stand out in the sunshine .
sentences.chinese: 在太阳下，那点点水泡似的蒙古包，闪烁着白光。

sentences.english: Where are these bubble coming from?
sentences.chinese: 这么多水泡来自于哪里呢？

sentences.english: But the clinical lesions share the same features with herpetic vesicles.
sentences.chinese: 但是疱疹病毒形成的水泡也会有相同的临床表现。

sentences.english: This may prevent blisters or raw skin from developing.
sentences.chinese: 这样可以防止水泡，破皮的发生。

sentences.english: I never experienced blisters but I did have some red peeling skin that was pretty itchy.
sentences.chinese: 我从来没有经历过水泡但我的确有发红脱皮并且奇痒。

sentences.english: Echocardiography showed a pericardial cystic mass with external compression of the right ventricle.
sentences.chinese: 心脏超音波显示心脏旁有一水泡状囊肿且压迫右心室。

sentences.english: That's not cheap, but it's a lot better than blisters and clammy feet.
sentences.chinese: 这并不便宜，但是这比生水泡和湿冷的脚要好得多。

sentences.english: In addition.It will have much bubble and in pipe after using a period of time. also It makes noisy.(all
sentences.chinese: 还有使用一段时间后管路里水泡很多，噪音很大。

sentences.english: The blisters were starting to burst open and their skin hung down like rugs.
sentences.chinese: 水泡破裂开，伤口的皮肤像破布一样悬挂着。

sentences.english: His heavy shoes raised blisters on his feet.
sentences.chinese: 他的鞋子太重，脚上磨出了水泡。

sentences.english: HE pricked tHE blister on his HEel with a sterilized needle.
sentences.chinese: 他用一根消过毒的针扎破脚后跟上的水泡。

sentences.english: It is present, but only in negligible quantities, in tears and blister fluid.
sentences.chinese: 泪水以及水泡中的确有HIV，但是量少到不会传。

sentences.english: Cricket is built by blisters, crops.
sentences.chinese: 蟋蟀上房叫，庄稼挨水泡。

sentences.english: As the cold sore becomes visible, small red spots and fluid blisters appear.
sentences.chinese: 当唇疱疹发展到可见的时候，会出现小红点和水泡。

sentences.english: These blisters can be fed back at a later time from the bulk magazine into the cartoning system.
sentences.chinese: 这些水泡，可反馈在离大容量杂志到装盒系统以后。

sentences.english: And if you're not used to wearing them, they can cause blisters, he added.
sentences.chinese: 他还说，如果你不习惯，穿人字拖还能使脚上起水泡。

definition: to bubble/to foam/to blister/to sprout boils (on one's body)/sparkling (wine etc)
puffed/swollen/spongy/small lake (esp. in place names)/classifier for urine or feces

bubble/foam/blister (i.e. skin bubble)/to soak/to steep/to infuse/to dawdle/to shilly-shally/to hang about/to pick up (a girl)/to get off with (a sexual partner)/classifier for occurrences of an action/classifier for number of infusions
